page.title: 20JOHN COLLIER - "TIM BOBBIN"
page.content: John Collier, who was the son of a vicar and originally came from Urmston in Manchester, was one of Milnrow's most famous figures. He began as a schoolmaster in Milnrow on November 19th, 1729. While in Milnrow he began writing books in Lancashire dialect and he used to illustrate his work using cartoons and drawings. Some of his work can be found in Rochdale Library. John Collier was known as Tim Bobbin. There is a public house of this name in Milnrow today. He died on July 14th, 1786, aged 77 years. His grave is in Rochdale churchyard.
